natural problem:
The expression
\[a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2)\]can be factored into the form  $(a - b)(b - c)(c - a) p(a,b,c),$ for some polynomial $p(a,b,c).$  Find $p(a,b,c).$
natural solution: First, we take out a factor of $a - b$: \begin{align} a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2) &= a^3 b^2 - a^2 b^3 + b^3 c^2 - a^3 c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\ &= a^2 b^2 (a - b) + (b^3 - a^3) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\

&= (a - b)[a^2 b^2 - (a^2 + ab + b^2) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)] \\ &= (a - b)(a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3). \end{align}We can then take out a factor of $b - c$: \begin{align} a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^3 - abc^2 + bc^3 - b^2 c^2 \\

&= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= a^2 (b - c)(b + c) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= (b - c)[a^2 (b + c) - ac^2 - bc^2] \\ &= (b - c)(a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2). \end{align}Finally, we take out a factor of $c - a$: \begin{align}

a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2 &= a^2 b - bc^2 + a^2 c - ac^2 \\ &= b (a^2 - c^2) + ac(a - c) \\ &= b (a - c)(a + c) + ac(a - c) \\ &= -(c - a)(ab + ac + bc). \end{align}Thus, $p(a,b,c) = \boxed{-(ab + ac + bc)}.$

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: real
and p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) 
= (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "p a b c = -(a * b + a * c + b * c)"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The expression
\[a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2)\]can be factored into the form  $(a - b)(b - c)(c - a) p(a,b,c),$ for some polynomial $p(a,b,c).$  Find $p(a,b,c).$ The final Answer is -(ab + ac + bc)
 ### Proof
 First, we take out a factor of $a - b$: \begin{align} a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2) &= a^3 b^2 - a^2 b^3 + b^3 c^2 - a^3 c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\ &= a^2 b^2 (a - b) + (b^3 - a^3) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\
 &= (a - b)[a^2 b^2 - (a^2 + ab + b^2) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)] \\ &= (a - b)(a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3). \end{align}We can then take out a factor of $b - c$: \begin{align} a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^3 - abc^2 + bc^3 - b^2 c^2 \\
 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= a^2 (b - c)(b + c) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= (b - c)[a^2 (b + c) - ac^2 - bc^2] \\ &= (b - c)(a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2). \end{align}Finally, we take out a factor of $c - a$: \begin{align}
 a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2 &= a^2 b - bc^2 + a^2 c - ac^2 \\ &= b (a^2 - c^2) + ac(a - c) \\ &= b (a - c)(a + c) + ac(a - c) \\ &= -(c - a)(ab + ac + bc). \end{align}Thus, $p(a,b,c) = \boxed{-(ab + ac + bc)}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real
and p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) 
= (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "p a b c = -(a * b + a * c + b * c)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: If $a^3(b^2 - c^2) + b^3(c^2 - a^2) + c^3(a^2 - b^2) = (a - b)(b - c)(c - a)p(a, b, c)$, find the function $p(a, b, c)$. The final answer is $p(a, b, c) = -(ab + ac + bc)$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: real and p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) = 
(a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "p a b c = -(a*b + a*c + b*c)"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The expression
\[a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2)\]can be factored into the form  $(a - b)(b - c)(c - a) p(a,b,c),$ for some polynomial $p(a,b,c).$  Find $p(a,b,c).$ The final Answer is -(ab + ac + bc)
 ### Proof
 First, we take out a factor of $a - b$: \begin{align} a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2) &= a^3 b^2 - a^2 b^3 + b^3 c^2 - a^3 c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\ &= a^2 b^2 (a - b) + (b^3 - a^3) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\
 &= (a - b)[a^2 b^2 - (a^2 + ab + b^2) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)] \\ &= (a - b)(a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3). \end{align}We can then take out a factor of $b - c$: \begin{align} a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^3 - abc^2 + bc^3 - b^2 c^2 \\
 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= a^2 (b - c)(b + c) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= (b - c)[a^2 (b + c) - ac^2 - bc^2] \\ &= (b - c)(a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2). \end{align}Finally, we take out a factor of $c - a$: \begin{align}
 a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2 &= a^2 b - bc^2 + a^2 c - ac^2 \\ &= b (a^2 - c^2) + ac(a - c) \\ &= b (a - c)(a + c) + ac(a - c) \\ &= -(c - a)(ab + ac + bc). \end{align}Thus, $p(a,b,c) = \boxed{-(ab + ac + bc)}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real and p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) = 
(a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "p a b c = -(a*b + a*c + b*c)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Given the function $p(a, b, c)$ such that $a^3(b^2 - c^2) + b^3(c^2 - a^2) + c^3(a^2 - b^2) = (a - b)(b - c)(c - a)p(a, b, c)$, find the value of $p(a, b, c)$. The final answer is $- (ab + ac + bc)$.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: real and p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "\<forall> a b c. p a b c = -(a * b + a * c + b * c)"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The expression
\[a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2)\]can be factored into the form  $(a - b)(b - c)(c - a) p(a,b,c),$ for some polynomial $p(a,b,c).$  Find $p(a,b,c).$ The final Answer is -(ab + ac + bc)
 ### Proof
 First, we take out a factor of $a - b$: \begin{align} a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2) &= a^3 b^2 - a^2 b^3 + b^3 c^2 - a^3 c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\ &= a^2 b^2 (a - b) + (b^3 - a^3) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\
 &= (a - b)[a^2 b^2 - (a^2 + ab + b^2) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)] \\ &= (a - b)(a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3). \end{align}We can then take out a factor of $b - c$: \begin{align} a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^3 - abc^2 + bc^3 - b^2 c^2 \\
 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= a^2 (b - c)(b + c) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= (b - c)[a^2 (b + c) - ac^2 - bc^2] \\ &= (b - c)(a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2). \end{align}Finally, we take out a factor of $c - a$: \begin{align}
 a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2 &= a^2 b - bc^2 + a^2 c - ac^2 \\ &= b (a^2 - c^2) + ac(a - c) \\ &= b (a - c)(a + c) + ac(a - c) \\ &= -(c - a)(ab + ac + bc). \end{align}Thus, $p(a,b,c) = \boxed{-(ab + ac + bc)}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real and p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "\<forall> a b c. p a b c = -(a * b + a * c + b * c)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: Given the equation $a^3(b^2 - c^2) + b^3(c^2 - a^2) + c^3(a^2 - b^2) = (a - b)(b - c)(c - a) p(a, b, c)$, find a general expression for $p(a, b, c)$. The final answer is $p(a, b, c) = -(ab + ac + bc)$.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: real and p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "\<forall> a b c. p a b c = - (a * b + a * c + b * c)"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The expression
\[a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2)\]can be factored into the form  $(a - b)(b - c)(c - a) p(a,b,c),$ for some polynomial $p(a,b,c).$  Find $p(a,b,c).$ The final Answer is -(ab + ac + bc)
 ### Proof
 First, we take out a factor of $a - b$: \begin{align} a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2) &= a^3 b^2 - a^2 b^3 + b^3 c^2 - a^3 c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\ &= a^2 b^2 (a - b) + (b^3 - a^3) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\
 &= (a - b)[a^2 b^2 - (a^2 + ab + b^2) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)] \\ &= (a - b)(a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3). \end{align}We can then take out a factor of $b - c$: \begin{align} a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^3 - abc^2 + bc^3 - b^2 c^2 \\
 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= a^2 (b - c)(b + c) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= (b - c)[a^2 (b + c) - ac^2 - bc^2] \\ &= (b - c)(a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2). \end{align}Finally, we take out a factor of $c - a$: \begin{align}
 a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2 &= a^2 b - bc^2 + a^2 c - ac^2 \\ &= b (a^2 - c^2) + ac(a - c) \\ &= b (a - c)(a + c) + ac(a - c) \\ &= -(c - a)(ab + ac + bc). \end{align}Thus, $p(a,b,c) = \boxed{-(ab + ac + bc)}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real and p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "\<forall> a b c. p a b c = - (a * b + a * c + b * c)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: Given that for any three real numbers $a$, $b$, $c$, the expression $a^3 * (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 * (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 * (a^2 - b^2)$ equals $(a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p(a,b,c)$, find the function $p(a,b,c)$ that makes this true for all $a$, $b$, $c$. The final answer is $p(a,b,c) = - (a * b + a * c + b * c)$.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "\<forall> a b c. p a b c = -(a * b + a * c + b * c)"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The expression
\[a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2)\]can be factored into the form  $(a - b)(b - c)(c - a) p(a,b,c),$ for some polynomial $p(a,b,c).$  Find $p(a,b,c).$ The final Answer is -(ab + ac + bc)
 ### Proof
 First, we take out a factor of $a - b$: \begin{align} a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2) &= a^3 b^2 - a^2 b^3 + b^3 c^2 - a^3 c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\ &= a^2 b^2 (a - b) + (b^3 - a^3) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\
 &= (a - b)[a^2 b^2 - (a^2 + ab + b^2) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)] \\ &= (a - b)(a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3). \end{align}We can then take out a factor of $b - c$: \begin{align} a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^3 - abc^2 + bc^3 - b^2 c^2 \\
 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= a^2 (b - c)(b + c) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= (b - c)[a^2 (b + c) - ac^2 - bc^2] \\ &= (b - c)(a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2). \end{align}Finally, we take out a factor of $c - a$: \begin{align}
 a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2 &= a^2 b - bc^2 + a^2 c - ac^2 \\ &= b (a^2 - c^2) + ac(a - c) \\ &= b (a - c)(a + c) + ac(a - c) \\ &= -(c - a)(ab + ac + bc). \end{align}Thus, $p(a,b,c) = \boxed{-(ab + ac + bc)}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "\<forall> a b c. p a b c = -(a * b + a * c + b * c)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: Given the formula $a^3*(b^2 - c^2) + b^3*(c^2 - a^2) + c^3*(a^2 - b^2) = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p(a, b, c)$, show that $p(a, b, c) = -(a * b + a * c + b * c)$ for all real numbers $a$, $b$, and $c$.

a_5.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. p a b c = -(a * b + a * c + b * c)"
and h1 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "p a b c = -(a * b + a * c + b * c)"
a_5.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The expression
\[a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2)\]can be factored into the form  $(a - b)(b - c)(c - a) p(a,b,c),$ for some polynomial $p(a,b,c).$  Find $p(a,b,c).$ The final Answer is -(ab + ac + bc)
 ### Proof
 First, we take out a factor of $a - b$: \begin{align} a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2) &= a^3 b^2 - a^2 b^3 + b^3 c^2 - a^3 c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\ &= a^2 b^2 (a - b) + (b^3 - a^3) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\
 &= (a - b)[a^2 b^2 - (a^2 + ab + b^2) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)] \\ &= (a - b)(a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3). \end{align}We can then take out a factor of $b - c$: \begin{align} a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^3 - abc^2 + bc^3 - b^2 c^2 \\
 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= a^2 (b - c)(b + c) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= (b - c)[a^2 (b + c) - ac^2 - bc^2] \\ &= (b - c)(a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2). \end{align}Finally, we take out a factor of $c - a$: \begin{align}
 a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2 &= a^2 b - bc^2 + a^2 c - ac^2 \\ &= b (a^2 - c^2) + ac(a - c) \\ &= b (a - c)(a + c) + ac(a - c) \\ &= -(c - a)(ab + ac + bc). \end{align}Thus, $p(a,b,c) = \boxed{-(ab + ac + bc)}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. p a b c = -(a * b + a * c + b * c)"
and h1 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "p a b c = -(a * b + a * c + b * c)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_5.informal problem: The function $p(a, b, c)$ is defined as $-(ab + ac + bc)$. It is also given that $a^3(b^2 - c^2) + b^3(c^2 - a^2) + c^3(a^2 - b^2) = (a - b)(b - c)(c - a)p(a, b, c)$. Confirm that the function $p(a, b, c)$ is indeed $-(ab + ac + bc)$.

a_6.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. p a b c = -(a*b + a*c + b*c)"
and h1 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "p a b c = -(a*b + a*c + b*c)"
a_6.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The expression
\[a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2)\]can be factored into the form  $(a - b)(b - c)(c - a) p(a,b,c),$ for some polynomial $p(a,b,c).$  Find $p(a,b,c).$ The final Answer is -(ab + ac + bc)
 ### Proof
 First, we take out a factor of $a - b$: \begin{align} a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2) &= a^3 b^2 - a^2 b^3 + b^3 c^2 - a^3 c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\ &= a^2 b^2 (a - b) + (b^3 - a^3) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\
 &= (a - b)[a^2 b^2 - (a^2 + ab + b^2) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)] \\ &= (a - b)(a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3). \end{align}We can then take out a factor of $b - c$: \begin{align} a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^3 - abc^2 + bc^3 - b^2 c^2 \\
 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= a^2 (b - c)(b + c) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= (b - c)[a^2 (b + c) - ac^2 - bc^2] \\ &= (b - c)(a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2). \end{align}Finally, we take out a factor of $c - a$: \begin{align}
 a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2 &= a^2 b - bc^2 + a^2 c - ac^2 \\ &= b (a^2 - c^2) + ac(a - c) \\ &= b (a - c)(a + c) + ac(a - c) \\ &= -(c - a)(ab + ac + bc). \end{align}Thus, $p(a,b,c) = \boxed{-(ab + ac + bc)}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. p a b c = -(a*b + a*c + b*c)"
and h1 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "p a b c = -(a*b + a*c + b*c)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_6.informal problem: For any real numbers a, b, and c, let p(a,b,c) be defined as -(a*b + a*c + b*c). Given that the expression a^3 * (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 * (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 * (a^2 - b^2) equals (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p(a,b,c), show that p(a,b,c) still equals -(a*b + a*c + b*c).

a_7.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: real and p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "p a b c = -(a*b + a*c + b*c)"
a_7.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The expression
\[a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2)\]can be factored into the form  $(a - b)(b - c)(c - a) p(a,b,c),$ for some polynomial $p(a,b,c).$  Find $p(a,b,c).$ The final Answer is -(ab + ac + bc)
 ### Proof
 First, we take out a factor of $a - b$: \begin{align} a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2) &= a^3 b^2 - a^2 b^3 + b^3 c^2 - a^3 c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\ &= a^2 b^2 (a - b) + (b^3 - a^3) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\
 &= (a - b)[a^2 b^2 - (a^2 + ab + b^2) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)] \\ &= (a - b)(a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3). \end{align}We can then take out a factor of $b - c$: \begin{align} a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^3 - abc^2 + bc^3 - b^2 c^2 \\
 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= a^2 (b - c)(b + c) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= (b - c)[a^2 (b + c) - ac^2 - bc^2] \\ &= (b - c)(a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2). \end{align}Finally, we take out a factor of $c - a$: \begin{align}
 a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2 &= a^2 b - bc^2 + a^2 c - ac^2 \\ &= b (a^2 - c^2) + ac(a - c) \\ &= b (a - c)(a + c) + ac(a - c) \\ &= -(c - a)(ab + ac + bc). \end{align}Thus, $p(a,b,c) = \boxed{-(ab + ac + bc)}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real and p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "p a b c = -(a*b + a*c + b*c)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_7.informal problem: For any three real numbers $a$, $b$, and $c$, find a function $p(a, b, c)$ such that the equation $a^3(b^2 - c^2) + b^3(c^2 - a^2) + c^3(a^2 - b^2) = (a - b)(b - c)(c - a)p(a, b, c)$ holds. The final answer is that $p(a, b, c) = -(ab + ac + bc)$.

a_8.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: real and p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "p a b c = -(a*b + a*c + b*c)"
a_8.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The expression
\[a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2)\]can be factored into the form  $(a - b)(b - c)(c - a) p(a,b,c),$ for some polynomial $p(a,b,c).$  Find $p(a,b,c).$ The final Answer is -(ab + ac + bc)
 ### Proof
 First, we take out a factor of $a - b$: \begin{align} a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2) &= a^3 b^2 - a^2 b^3 + b^3 c^2 - a^3 c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\ &= a^2 b^2 (a - b) + (b^3 - a^3) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\
 &= (a - b)[a^2 b^2 - (a^2 + ab + b^2) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)] \\ &= (a - b)(a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3). \end{align}We can then take out a factor of $b - c$: \begin{align} a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^3 - abc^2 + bc^3 - b^2 c^2 \\
 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= a^2 (b - c)(b + c) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= (b - c)[a^2 (b + c) - ac^2 - bc^2] \\ &= (b - c)(a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2). \end{align}Finally, we take out a factor of $c - a$: \begin{align}
 a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2 &= a^2 b - bc^2 + a^2 c - ac^2 \\ &= b (a^2 - c^2) + ac(a - c) \\ &= b (a - c)(a + c) + ac(a - c) \\ &= -(c - a)(ab + ac + bc). \end{align}Thus, $p(a,b,c) = \boxed{-(ab + ac + bc)}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: real and p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2) = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "p a b c = -(a*b + a*c + b*c)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_8.informal problem: For all real numbers $a$, $b$, and $c$, if $a^3(b^2 - c^2) + b^3(c^2 - a^2) + c^3(a^2 - b^2) = (a - b)(b - c)(c - a)p(a, b, c)$, then find $p(a, b, c)$ in terms of $a$, $b$, and $c$. The result is $p(a, b, c) = -(a*b + a*c + b*c)$.

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. P a b c = a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2)"
and h1 : "\<forall> a b c. P a b c = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "\<forall> a b c. p a b c = -(a*b + a*c + b*c)"
a_9.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The expression
\[a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2)\]can be factored into the form  $(a - b)(b - c)(c - a) p(a,b,c),$ for some polynomial $p(a,b,c).$  Find $p(a,b,c).$ The final Answer is -(ab + ac + bc)
 ### Proof
 First, we take out a factor of $a - b$: \begin{align} a^3 (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 (a^2 - b^2) &= a^3 b^2 - a^2 b^3 + b^3 c^2 - a^3 c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\ &= a^2 b^2 (a - b) + (b^3 - a^3) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)(a - b) \\
 &= (a - b)[a^2 b^2 - (a^2 + ab + b^2) c^2 + c^3 (a + b)] \\ &= (a - b)(a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3). \end{align}We can then take out a factor of $b - c$: \begin{align} a^2 b^2 - a^2 c^2 - abc^2 - b^2 c^2 + ac^3 + bc^3 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^3 - abc^2 + bc^3 - b^2 c^2 \\
 &= a^2 (b^2 - c^2) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= a^2 (b - c)(b + c) + ac^2 (c - b) + bc^2 (c - b) \\ &= (b - c)[a^2 (b + c) - ac^2 - bc^2] \\ &= (b - c)(a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2). \end{align}Finally, we take out a factor of $c - a$: \begin{align}
 a^2 b + a^2 c - ac^2 - bc^2 &= a^2 b - bc^2 + a^2 c - ac^2 \\ &= b (a^2 - c^2) + ac(a - c) \\ &= b (a - c)(a + c) + ac(a - c) \\ &= -(c - a)(ab + ac + bc). \end{align}Thus, $p(a,b,c) = \boxed{-(ab + ac + bc)}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c p :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> a b c. P a b c = a powr 3 * (b powr 2 - c powr 2) + b powr 3 * (c powr 2 - a powr 2) + c powr 3 * (a powr 2 - b powr 2)"
and h1 : "\<forall> a b c. P a b c = (a - b) * (b - c) * (c - a) * p a b c"
shows  "\<forall> a b c. p a b c = -(a*b + a*c + b*c)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_9.informal problem: Given the function $P(a, b, c) = a^3 \cdot (b^2 - c^2) + b^3 \cdot (c^2 - a^2) + c^3 \cdot (a^2 - b^2)$ and the equation $P(a, b, c) = (a - b) \cdot (b - c) \cdot (c - a) \cdot p(a, b, c)$, find the function $p(a, b, c)$ such that $p(a, b, c) = -(a \cdot b + a \cdot c + b \cdot c)$.
